      • connectHandler

        public NetServer connectHandler(Handler<NetSocket> connectHandler)
        Description copied from interface: NetServer
        Supply a connect handler for this server. The server can only have at most one connect handler at any one time. As the server accepts TCP or SSL connections it creates an instance of NetSocket and passes it to the connect handler.
        Specified by:
        connectHandler in interface NetServer
        Returns:
        a reference to this so multiple method calls can be chained together

        public void close(Handler<java.lang.Void> done)

        public NetServer setSSL(boolean ssl)

      • setKeyStorePath

        public NetServer setKeyStorePath(java.lang.String path)
        Description copied from interface: NetServer
        Set the path to the SSL key store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after NetServer.setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        The SSL key store is a standard Java Key Store which should contain the server certificate.

        Specified by:
        setKeyStorePath in interface NetServer
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setKeyStorePassword

        public NetServer setKeyStorePassword(java.lang.String pwd)
        Description copied from interface: NetServer
        Set the password for the SSL key store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after NetServer.setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        Specified by:
        setKeyStorePassword in interface NetServer
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setTrustStorePath

        public NetServer setTrustStorePath(java.lang.String path)
        Description copied from interface: NetServer
        Set the path to the SSL trust store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after NetServer.setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        The trust store is a standard Java Key Store, and should contain the certificates of any clients that the server trusts - this is only necessary if client authentication is enabled.

        Specified by:
        setTrustStorePath in interface NetServer
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setTrustStorePassword

        public NetServer setTrustStorePassword(java.lang.String pwd)
        Description copied from interface: NetServer
        Set the password for the SSL trust store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after NetServer.setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        Specified by:
        setTrustStorePassword in interface NetServer
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setClientAuthRequired

        public NetServer setClientAuthRequired(boolean required)
        Description copied from interface: NetServer
        Set required to true if you want the server to request client authentication from any connecting clients. This is an extra level of security in SSL, and requires clients to provide client certificates. Those certificates must be added to the server trust store.
        Specified by:
        setClientAuthRequired in interface NetServer
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.
